subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The Pivot Graveyard: When Giving Up the Idea Is the Idea
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Pivot Graveyard: When Giving Up the Idea Is the Idea.

hook.text: YouTube started as a video dating site called 'Tune In, Hook Up.' Nobody uploaded dating videos.

buildup.text: The founders noticed people uploading random clips instead. They dropped the dating angle entirely.

discovery.text: Instagram began as Burbn, a check-in app. The only feature anyone used was photo sharing.

twist.text: Nintendo started as a playing card company. Nokia once made rubber boots. The first idea rarely survives.

climax.text: The greatest companies aren't loyal to their first idea. They're loyal to finding what actually works.

punchline.text: Stubbornness kills more startups than bad ideas do.

quiz.question: What do YouTube, Instagram, and Nintendo have in common?
options: They were all founded by the same group of investors
They all started as something completely different before pivoting to what made them famous
They all failed at least three times before finding success
